title: The off-equilibrium Kinetic Ising model: The Metric Case
abstract:
We investigate the critical behavior of the Kinetic Ising model with
non-reciprocal nearest neighbors interactions. A finite-size scaling study
suggests that the model belongs to the Ising universality class. We
characterize the off-equilibrium behavior of the model by measuring the entropy
production rate and by studying the coarsening dynamics, which shows a
super-diffusive relaxation. A coarse-grained equation of motion is in
compelling agreement with the numerical findings. A one-loop renormalization
group calculation shows that the model belongs to the Model A universality
class.
